messages.content: What is ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader is a custom node for ComfyUI that downloads and loads models from a given URL temporarily into memory without saving them to storage.
How do you install ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?

To install ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader, first execute `git clone https://github.com/pkpkTech/ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader` in the custom_nodes directory of ComfyUI. Then navigate to the ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader directory and run `pip install -r requirements.txt`.
What nodes are added to the 'temporary_loader' category by ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader adds 'Load Checkpoint (Temporary)' and 'Load LoRA (Temporary)' nodes to the 'temporary_loader' category in ComfyUI.
What additional items are included in the standard Load nodes in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader compared to the regular ComfyUI Load nodes?

In addition to the standard Load nodes, ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader includes the following items: 'ckpt_url' for specifying the URL of the model to use, 'ckpt_type' for indicating the type of model, and 'download_split' for setting the number of parallel download splits.
What is the purpose of the 'Load Multi LoRA (Temporary)' node in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
The 'Load Multi LoRA (Temporary)' node in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader is used to load multiple LoRAs by specifying URLs or file names in a specific format.
What format should be used when specifying LoRAs in the 'Load Multi LoRA (Temporary)' node?

When specifying LoRAs in the 'Load Multi LoRA (Temporary)' node, the format should be: `{LoRA URL}` or `file:{LoRA file name}`. Examples include `https://example.com/anylora.safetensors` or `file:anylora.safetensors`.
How can comments be added when specifying LoRAs in the 'Load Multi LoRA (Temporary)' node?
Comments can be added when specifying LoRAs in the 'Load Multi LoRA (Temporary)' node by starting the line with `#`. For example, `#あのLoRA` followed by the LoRA URL or file name.
What is ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader is a custom node of ComfyUI that downloads and loads models from the input URL temporarily into memory without saving them to storage.
What are the use cases for ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader is useful when trying out models or when using various models on machines with limited storage.
What are the steps to install ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?

To install ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader, first use 'git clone https://github.com/pkpkTech/ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader' in your ComfyUI custom_nodes directory, then use 'pip install -r requirements.txt' in the ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader directory.
What nodes are added by ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader adds 'Load Checkpoint (Temporary)', 'Load LoRA (Temporary)', and 'Load Multi LoRA (Temporary)' nodes to the temporary_loader category.
What additional items are included in the Load node of ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?

In addition to the standard Load node, ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader includes 'ckpt_url' for the URL of the model, 'ckpt_type' to automatically detect the file extension, and 'download_split' to specify the number of splits for parallel downloading.
How can you load multiple LoRAs using ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?

You can load multiple LoRAs using the 'Load Multi LoRA (Temporary)' node in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader by specifying the URL or filename of the LoRA in a specific format, such as '{LoRA URL}' or 'file:{LoRA file name}'.
How can you add comments to avoid confusion about LoRA in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
In ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader, you can add comments by starting the line with '#'. For example, '#thatLoRA' followed by the URL or filename of the LoRA.
